content.question: Which of the following describes the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></math>-coordinates of the points on the curve <math alttext="cosine x, equals, e raised to the y power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane where the curve has a horizontal tangent line?

choices.label: The values <math alttext="n pi " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for all integers <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

The values <math alttext="the fraction pi over 2, plus n pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>n</mi><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for all integers <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

The values <math alttext="open parenthesis, 2 n plus 1, close parenthesis, times pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for all integers <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

The values <math alttext="2 n times pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for all integers <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: The values <math alttext="2 n times pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for all integers <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
